result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Bankhead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (>$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit (through trustee credit) of 
29 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with Brookfield Square Mall including Sears. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposeed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Cse 14CM909 was dismissed and read in.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for 60 Days compliance with Day Report Center. Consecutive to present sentence.
Consecutive to: Day Report Center  consecutive to present sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Darnell Bankhead in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 29 days) (trustee credit given)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:  Brookfield Square Mall (to include Sears)
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____ 60 Days Day Report Center -consecutive to current sentence Defendant is serving

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - for 60 Days Report Center (consecutive to present sentence Defendant is serving) 


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Darnell Bankhead in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Darnell Bankhead in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas K Martinez.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a new date as the matter will be a waiver. State has no objection.  Court grants the adjournment request.   Bail remains as fixed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.
